page.title: 09 Southorpe (1200-1288)
page.content: {the outskirts of Southorpe,another {village in our block.The land around {used to be quarries.They were not {large as they were dug out by {hand.Locally they are known as 'hills {and holes'. {1200's A man called Elisade Beckingham { is recorded as having held land { in the south. {1288 Beckingham granted 2 mills to the { Abbot of Peterborough on the { condition a service should be { celebrated twice daily for the { soul of Queen Eleanor and that on { her anniversary 200 poor people { of the parish should be given } { food in her name. { Also a friendly agreement was { recorded between Geoffrey Ridel, { Lord of Wittering and Peter Abbas { concerning the Mill pond to the { south. }
